alert.note: Alert for Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mingo County through 530 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buskirk, or near Williamson, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Delbarton, Chattaroy, Buskirk, Red Jacket, Matewan, Myrtle and Lenore. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
